verses.verse: For <WG1063> this <WG3778> Melchizedek, <WG3198> king <WG935> of Salem, <WG4532> priest <WG2409> of God <WG2316> Most High, <WG5310> who <WG3588> met <WG4876> Abraham <WG11> returning <WG5290> from <WG575> the slaughter <WG2871> of the kings <WG935> and <WG2532> blessed <WG2127> him, <WG846>

to whom <WG3739> also <WG2532> Abraham <WG11> divided <WG3307> a tenth part <WG1181> of <WG575> all <WG3956> (being first, <WG4412> <WG3303> by interpretation, <WG2059> king <WG935> of righteousness, <WG1343> and <WG1161> then <WG1899> also <WG2532> king <WG935> of Salem, <WG4532> which is <WG3603> king <WG935> of peace; <WG1515>

without father, <WG540> without mother, <WG282> without genealogy, <WG2192> having <WG2192> neither <WG3383> beginning <WG746> of days <WG2250> nor <WG3383> end <WG5056> of life, <WG2222> but <WG1161> made like <WG871> the Son <WG5207> of God <WG2316>), remains <WG3306> a priest <WG2409> <WG1519> continually. <WG1336>

Now <WG1161> consider <WG2334> how great <WG4080> this man <WG3778> was, <WG3739> to whom even <WG2532> Abraham, <WG11> the patriarch, <WG3966> gave <WG1325> a tenth <WG1181> out of <WG1537> the best spoils. <WG2334>

<WG2532> They indeed <WG3303> <WG2983> of <WG1537> the sons <WG5207> of Levi <WG3017> who receive <WG2983> the priest <WG2405>'s office have <WG2192> a commandment <WG1785> to take tithes of <WG586> the people <WG2992> according to <WG2596> the law, <WG3551> that <WG5124> is, <WG2076> of <WG80> their <WG846> brothers, <WG80> though <WG2539> these have come out <WG1831> of <WG1537> the body <WG3751> of Abraham, <WG11>

but <WG1161> he whose genealogy is <WG1075> not <WG3361> counted <WG1075> from <WG1537> them <WG846> has accepted tithes <WG1183> from Abraham, <WG11> and <WG2532> has blessed <WG2127> him who has <WG2192> the promises. <WG1860>
But <WG1161> without <WG5565> any <WG3956> dispute <WG485> the lesser <WG1640> is blessed <WG2127> by <WG5259> the greater. <WG2909>

<WG2532> Here <WG5602> <WG99999> people <WG444> who die <WG599> receive <WG2983> tithes, <WG1181> but <WG1161> there <WG1563> one <WG3140> receives tithes of whom it is testified <WG3140> that <WG3754> he lives. <WG2198>
<WG2532> We can <WG5613> say <WG2031> that through <WG1223> Abraham <WG11> even <WG2532> Levi, <WG3017> who receives <WG2983> tithes, <WG1181> has paid tithes, <WG1183>
for <WG1063> he was <WG2258> yet <WG2089> in <WG1722> the body <WG3751> of his father <WG3962> when <WG3753> Melchizedek <WG3198> met <WG4876> him. <WG846>

Now if <WG1487> there <WG3767> were <WG3303> perfection <WG5050> <WG2258> through <WG1223> the Levitical <WG3020> priesthood <WG2420> (for <WG1063> under <WG1909> it <WG846> the people <WG2992> have received the law <WG3549>), what <WG5101> further <WG2089> need <WG5532> was there for <WG450> another <WG2087> priest <WG2409> to arise <WG450> after <WG2596> the order <WG5010> of Melchizedek, <WG3198> and <WG2532> not <WG3756> be called <WG3004> after <WG2596> the order <WG5010> of Aaron? <WG2>
For <WG1063> the priesthood <WG2420> being changed, <WG3346> there is of <WG1537> necessity <WG318> a change <WG3331> made <WG1096> also <WG2532> in the law. <WG3551>

For <WG1063> he <WG3348> of <WG1909> whom <WG3739> these things <WG5023> are said <WG3004> belongs <WG3348> to <WG5443> another <WG2087> tribe, <WG5443> from <WG575> which <WG3739> no one <WG3762> has officiated <WG4337> at the altar. <WG2379>

For <WG1063> it is evident <WG4271> that <WG3754> our <WG2257> Lord <WG2962> has sprung <WG393> out of <WG1537> Judah, <WG2448> about <WG1519> which <WG3739> tribe <WG5443> Moses <WG3475> spoke <WG2980> nothing <WG3762> concerning <WG4012> priesthood. <WG2420>

This <WG2532> is <WG2076> yet <WG2089> more <WG4054> abundantly evident, <WG2612> if <WG1487> after <WG2596> the likeness <WG3665> of Melchizedek <WG3198> there arises <WG450> another <WG2087> priest, <WG2409>

who <WG3739> has been made, <WG1096> not <WG3756> after <WG2596> the law <WG3551> of a <WG1785> fleshly <WG4559> commandment, <WG1785> but <WG235> after <WG2596> the power <WG1411> of an <WG2222> endless <WG179> life: <WG2222>
for <WG1063> it is testified, <WG3754> "You <WG4771> are a priest <WG2409> forever, <WG1519> <WG165> according <WG2596> to the order <WG5010> of Melchizedek. <WG3198>"
For <WG1063> there is <WG1096> <WG99999> an annulling <WG115> of a foregoing <WG4254> commandment <WG1785> because <WG1223> of its <WG846> weakness <WG772> and <WG2532> uselessness <WG512>

(for <WG1063> the law <WG3551> made <WG5048> nothing <WG3762> perfect <WG5048>), and a <WG1680> bringing in <WG1898> of a <WG1680> better <WG2909> hope, <WG1680> through <WG1223> which <WG3739> we draw near <WG1448> to God. <WG2316>
<WG2532> Inasmuch <WG2596> as <WG3745> he was not <WG3756> made priest without <WG5565> the taking of an oath <WG3728>

(for <WG1063> <WG99999> they indeed have been <WG1526> made <WG1096> priests <WG2409> without <WG5565> an oath <WG3728>), but <WG1161> he with <WG3326> an oath <WG3728> by <WG1223> him <WG846> that says <WG3004> of <WG4314> him, <WG846> "The Lord <WG2962> swore <WG3660> and <WG2532> will <WG3338> not <WG3756> change his mind, <WG3338> <WG4771> 'You are a priest <WG2409> forever, <WG1519> <WG165> according <WG2596> to the order <WG5010> of Melchizedek. <WG3198>'"
By <WG2596> so much, <WG5118> Jesus <WG2424> has <WG1096> become <WG1096> the collateral <WG1450> of a <WG1242> better <WG2909> covenant. <WG1242>
<WG2532> Many, <WG4119> indeed, <WG3303> have been <WG1526> made <WG1096> priests, <WG2409> because <WG1223> they <WG1526> are hindered <WG2967> from continuing <WG3887> by death. <WG2288>
But <WG1161> <WG3588> he, <WG846> because <WG1223> he <WG846> lives <WG3306> forever, <WG1519> <WG165> has <WG2192> his priesthood <WG2420> unchangeable. <WG531>

Therefore <WG3606> he is also <WG2532> able <WG1410> to <WG1519> save <WG4982> to <WG1519> the uttermost <WG3838> those who draw near <WG4334> to God <WG2316> through <WG1223> him, <WG846> seeing that he <WG2198> lives <WG2198> forever <WG3842> to <WG1519> make intercession <WG1793> for <WG5228> them. <WG846>

For <WG1063> such <WG5108> a high priest <WG749> was fitting <WG4241> for us: <WG2254> holy, <WG3741> guiltless, <WG172> undefiled, <WG283> separated <WG5563> from <WG575> sinners, <WG268> and <WG2532> made <WG1096> higher <WG5308> than the heavens; <WG3772>

who <WG3739> <WG2192> doesn't <WG3756> need, <WG318> <WG2596> like <WG5618> those high priests, <WG749> to offer up <WG399> sacrifices <WG2378> daily, <WG2250> first <WG4386> for <WG5228> his own <WG2398> sins, <WG266> and then <WG1899> for the sins of the people. <WG2992> For <WG1063> he did <WG4160> this <WG5124> once <WG2178> for all, <WG399> when he offered up himself. <WG1438>
